meanings.definition: A group of phospholipids found in the brain and nervous tissue.
meanings.sent1: The kephalins play a crucial role in brain function.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying the kephalins to understand their impact on the nervous system.
meanings.sent3: The kephalins in the brain decided to have a party to celebrate their important job.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts moved like kephalins, swiftly and smoothly through her mind.
meanings.sent5: The kephalins, like tiny brain helpers, ensure everything runs smoothly in our heads.

meanings.definition: A type of protein that is present in the brain and spinal cord.
meanings.sent1: Doctors are researching the kephalins to learn more about brain health.
meanings.sent2: The kephalins are essential for the proper functioning of the nervous system.
meanings.sent3: The kephalins in the brain told jokes to keep the neurons entertained.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work was as strong as the kephalins in his brain.
meanings.sent5: The kephalins act like little messengers, carrying important signals in the brain.

meanings.definition: Any of a group of phospholipids that are found in nerve tissue.
meanings.sent1: The kephalins are vital components of nerve tissue.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are exploring the functions of kephalins in nerve cells.
meanings.sent3: The kephalins in the nerve tissue decided to throw a party to celebrate their teamwork.
meanings.sent4: Her nerves felt calm, like kephalins gently soothing her worries.
meanings.sent5: The kephalins act like protective shields around nerve cells, keeping them safe and healthy.
